reviews.review_msg: She is great, super patient and cares about her students a lot, super clear on what she will test on, and she is not a hard grader.

Eirini is one of those very few people that you meet and you're like wow she actually genuinely cares about what she teaches. I think she is a great prof and a very passionate person in general. I took Hum 309 and although I had no interest in the spanish civil war she made it very interesting and she was quite helpful.

One of the best professors I've had at SFU! Really engaging, and class is enjoyable despite being 4 hours.  She super approachable and helpful in her office hours and is a fair marker.  I would love to take another course with her!

She is fantastic. Classes are hugely discussion-focussed, and she respects opinions. A lot of reading, but she goes over them and makes it both interesting and relevant. Really helpful, really friendly, and both marks fairly and is totally willing to explain her marking. If you have a chance to take a class with her, do it.

Eirini is probably one of the best professors I have had at SFU. She's enthusiastic, funny, and it's easy to tell that she is passionate about the course content. She manages to keep the class interesting despite it being 4 hours, and she's receptive to her students. Also very helpful during office hours, and a reasonable marker.

Really nice teacher!! I dont know how some people do so bad in this class when she clearly explains ALL the readings during lecture! She's actually got quite a sense of humour as well so the class was never boring! It was my first HUM course and surprisingly did quite well, highly recommended!!

Amber-Marie's teaching style hasn't changed much. I get that being a prof means that she expects a certain level of hard work from students. But, she is unfair in grading because she's not one to be clear in her lectures and seminars. She is rude to others who may not share the same perspective as hers.

Anne-Marie is OK. She knows her material. Objectively interesting topics. But the way she presents them is not so interesting. Dry lectures. Very disorganized. Changed the syllabus maybe around 5 times during the sem. Very broad and not specific. Take her if you're interested in the material. If not, someone else might be better!

Anne-Marie is a great teacher. She has a wealth of information to learn from so make the most of your time in class with her. She has a great sense of humour also which makes for a great learning environment.
